qas.question: How many pounds does one of Schwarzenegger's Hummers weigh?
How much did Schwarzenegger spend to convert a Hummer to run on hydrogen?
What did Schwarzenegger name his plan to build hydrogen refueling stations throughout California?
What governmental department contributed a grant to Schwarzenegger's hydrogen fuel project?

context: The Hummers that Schwarzenegger bought 1992 are so large – each weighs <a0_0>6,300<a0_0/> lb (2,900 kg) and is 7 feet (2.1 m) wide – that they are classified as large trucks, and U.S. fuel economy regulations do not apply to them. During the gubernatorial recall campaign he announced that he would convert one of his Hummers to burn hydrogen. The conversion was reported to have cost about US<a1_0>$21,000<a1_0/>. After the election, he signed an executive order to jump-start the building of hydrogen refueling plants called the <a2_0>California Hydrogen Highway Network<a2_0/>, and gained a <a3_0>U.S. Department of Energy<a3_0/> grant to help pay for its projected US$91,000,000 cost. California took delivery of the first H2H (Hydrogen Hummer) in October 2004.
